title: Florida Medicaid for Autism Services
shortDescription: Florida's comprehensive health coverage program that covers many autism therapies and supports with little to no cost.
description: Florida Medicaid provides health coverage to eligible children and adults with autism. It covers a wide range of services including ABA therapy, speech therapy, occupational therapy, medical evaluations, and more. Most services require no copay for children. Florida Medicaid is managed by the Agency for Health Care Administration (AHCA) and includes several managed care plans that families can choose from.
whoQualifies: Children and adults meeting income and disability requirements
Children with disabilities may qualify regardless of family income through Katie Beckett
Pregnant women and children in low-income families
Adults with disabilities who meet SSI criteria
whatIsCovered: ABA therapy (Applied Behavior Analysis) - up to 40 hours per week
Speech therapy, occupational therapy, physical therapy
Early intervention services for children under 3
Home health services when medically necessary
howToApply: Visit your local Department of Children and Families (DCF) office
Call 1-866-762-2237 to request an application by mail
Provide proof of income, residency, and citizenship
Submit medical documentation of autism diagnosis
For Katie Beckett, apply through your local DCF office with a physician's statement

typicalCosts.copays: $0 for children; small copays for some adult services

floridaSpecificInfo: Florida has 11 Medicaid managed care plans to choose from
Families can switch plans during open enrollment
Prior authorization may be required for some therapies
Katie Beckett waiver allows children with disabilities to qualify regardless of parent income
Services must be provided by Medicaid-enrolled providers

commonQuestions.question: How many ABA therapy hours does Florida Medicaid cover?
commonQuestions.answer: Florida Medicaid covers up to 40 hours per week of ABA therapy when medically necessary and prescribed by a doctor.

commonQuestions.question: Do I need prior authorization for therapies?
commonQuestions.answer: Yes, most therapies require prior authorization from your managed care plan. Your provider will typically handle this process.

commonQuestions.question: Can I see any therapist with Medicaid?
commonQuestions.answer: No, you must see providers enrolled with Florida Medicaid and in-network with your managed care plan.

commonQuestions.question: What if my child needs services not covered by my plan?
commonQuestions.answer: You can request an exception or appeal. The iBudget Waiver may also help cover additional services.
